alert.note: Alert for Allen; De Kalb; Huntington; Miami; Wabash; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 10:22PM EST until February 03 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches by Thursday evening. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana and northwest Ohio. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact all commutes through Thursday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While a lull in the snow moves in tonight, the snow is expected to move back in as another wave comes back in starting late tonight and early Thursday morning and continuing Thursday. The northwestern extent of this area of snow is uncertain as drier/colder air comes in and likely creates a sharp cutoff on that northern end. Additional accumulations of 2 to 5 inches can be expected along with blowing and drifting of snow on east to west and mainly rural roads.
info.instruction: This storm will bring dangerous driving conditions through Thursday. Unplowed roads are likely to become impassable in many areas. Plummeting wind chills accompanied by blowing and drifting snow could bring a potentially lethal travel situation with wind chills falling below zero if you become stuck in your vehicle later Thursday/Thursday night. Plan now to make any needed travel changes to avoid travel during this time. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this winter storm. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Allen; De Kalb; Huntington; Miami; Wabash; Whitley
